New Records: Germany achieved their first competitive win over Hungary since the 1954 World Cup final.
Key Match Events: Jamal Musiala scored the opening goal in the 22nd minute after a defensive error by Hungary.
Ilkay Gündogan scored the second goal in the 67th minute with a simple finish after a clinical build-up.
Roland Sallai had a goal ruled out in first-half stoppage time for Hungary.
Manuel Neuer made a crucial save from a Dominik Szoboszlai freekick.
Barnabás Varga missed a chance to level the score by heading over the bar after half-time.
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary manager Marco Rossi emphasized the need to avoid mistakes before the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Ilkay Gündogan commented on the team's need to overcome problems and survive difficult situations.
Hungary manager Marco Rossi acknowledged Germany as possibly the biggest favorite to win the Euro.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was watched by German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
The game took place in a lively atmosphere with fans partying around Stuttgart.
Germany became the first team to reach the Euro 2024 knockouts.
